title: Congratulations to Microsoft Leap Engineering Girls (Cohort 2)
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: The Women Techsters program has had another success as two of our beneciaries got into the 2nd cohort of the Microsoft Leap Engineering program.

title: ATC Digital Village Graduation Ceremony in Kebbi
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: We have had another record breakthrough as 23 youths graduated from the digital skills training in Argungu, Kebbi State.

title: Microsoft Philanthropies features a story on Women Techsters
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: It is one thing to do the work and another to be recognized for it: This is why we are excited about the Women Techsters story featured on the Microsoft website.

title: Minister of Youth and Sport Visits ATC DV in Agege
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: The Honorable Minister of Youth and Sport for the Federal Republic of Nigeria, Honorable Sunday Dare recently paid a courtesy visit to one of the ATC Digital Village centers in Agege, Lagos State.

title: Tech4Dev visits Makoko Community for ATC Digital Village
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: Tech4Dev representatives joined an introductory meeting held in the Makoko community at the Digital Village Center on 18th February 2020.

title: Nigerian Women Techsters Lagos Cohort 1
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: The Nigerian Women Techsters initiative, with the goal of training 2,400 women across 12 states in Nigeria, is rounding up with the Lagos cohort. The program will introduce learners to digital and analytical skills to kick start a career in tech.

title: Nakise-GIZ Cohort 4
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: The Nakise offline training is on its 4th cohort in partnership with Nigerian-German Centre for Jobs, Migration, and Re-integration, with the objective to train youths on employability and workplace efficiency skills.

title: Women Techsters – GIZ Cohort 4
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: With our continued resolve to bridge the gap of gender equality in the technology ecosystem, our partnership with The Nigerian-German Centre for Jobs, Migration, and Reintegration has birthed the 4th cohort of the Women Techsters training.

title: Nigeria Women Techsters – Imo Closing/Demo Day
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: The Imo state Nigerian Women Techsters training held in Owerri, Imo state, has successfully trained 270 women on digital and deep tech skills.

title: Women Techsters selected as the only Nigerian Solution at the UN Solutions Summit
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: We were at the UN Solution Summit, a catalytic gathering at the United Nations Headquarters during UN General Assembly Week. It was an exciting experience; we were selected for the Summit to present our solution ‘Women Techsters” in New York.

title: Congratulations to the Microsoft Leap Engineering Girls
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: Fatima, Abiodun, and Bello were beneficiaries of the Women Techsters program in the 2nd and 3rd cohort; they were amateurs to coding before joining the WT program. The Women Techsters is an initiative of Tech4Dev that trains women and girls on digital and deep tech skills.

title: Nakise-GIZ Cohort 4 Offline Program
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: We just concluded 4th Nakise offline cohort in partnership with Nigerian-German for Jobs, Migration and re-integration.

title: Women Techsters - GIZ Cohort 3 Internship
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: The Women Techsters beneficiaries are currently undergoing their internship where they will gain hands on experience based on their learnings on web development.

title: Nakise-GIZ Cohort 2&3 Offline Program
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: The NAKISE program is an initiative that is built to foster employability, entrepreneurship, and enable workplace efficiency. The NAKISE offline program organized in partnership with organizations trains youths on essential career skills.

title: Nigerian Women Techsters - Kano Closing/Demo Day
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: Kano state took part in the experiential learning program of the Nigerian Women Techsters starting from 4th May 2019 to 6th July 2019. The Demo day/closing ceremony held at the Startup Kano Hub on 13th July 2019 with 90 women graduating from the program.

title: Women Techsters in Partnership with German Centre for Jobs, Migration and Re-Integration Cohort 3 Closing/Demo Day Program
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: The Nigerian Women Techsters started its training program in Imo state. The training kick-started on 15th June 2019 with the opening ceremony.The cohort started on 3rd June through 19th June 2019. The training was a two weeks’ intensive boot camp covering Web and Mobile development.

title: Nigerian Women Techsters – Imo State Training Program
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: The Nigerian Women Techsters started its training program in Imo state. The training kick-started on 15th June 2019 with the opening ceremony.The opening day had in attendance over 130 women from the different local government areas parts of Imo state; dignitaries, guests from the Office of the First Lady Imo State and Office of the Secretary to the State Government were also present.

title: Nigerian Women Techsters – Delta State Closing/Demo Day
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: The Nigerian Women Techsters program empowers women in underserved communities, giving them leverage to build careers in technology, study STEM courses and run their tech businesses or manage technology-leveraged enterprises.

title: Nakise Offline Pilot Cohort
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: The NAKISE program is an initiative that is built to foster employability, entrepreneurship, and enable workplace efficiency. Nakise.ng is an online platform that is equipped with learning materials to enhance users with knowledge for competence in business and corporate work.

title: NWT Delta State Training
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: The Nigerian Women Techsters started its 3rd cohort in Warri, Delta state. On 20th March 2019, The training is divided into three primary tracks: web and mobile development, games development, and embedded systems.

title: Nigerian-German Centre for Jobs, Migration and Re-integration partners with TECH4DEV on Women Techsters
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: Tech4Dev has successfully graduated another of a set of Women Techsters powered by Nigerian-German Centre for Jobs, Migration, and Re6-integration (GIZ).

title: NWT Kano State Training
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: On 4th May 2019, the NWT training started in Kano state with 96 women in attendance on the first day of training. The women were introduced to the relevance of acquiring tech skills and opportunities within the tech space in the 21st century.
